channel.title: Generating different HTML for bots
channel.description:
I'm having trouble making my content search engine friendly AND user friendly. I don't want to comprimise the layout just for the sake of search engines.
All the content is generated in PHP, so would it be a good idea to generate search engine friendly content when the user agent of a bot is detected, or don't search engines like this?
Obviously all the text and images etc would be the same, just presented so it's much easier for a bot to index.

item.title: Generating different HTML for bots
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

yer thats what i was looking for! Couldnt remember what it was though ^^ Thanks

Options +FollowSymLinks RewriteEngine on RewriteRule ^([a-zA-Z]+)\.html$ index.php/$1 [NC,L]

this doesnt work for the url http://www.young-guns.biz/new/news.html

it is meant to forward to http://www.young-guns.biz/new/index.php/news

working, had to use different URI string

Read full topic

item.title: Generating different HTML for bots
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

I think you need to use mod rewrite rules in a htaccess file:

http://www.roscripts.com/Pretty_URLs_-_a_guide_to_URL_rewriting-168.html

Read full topic

item.title: Generating different HTML for bots
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

I have a similar problem, my urls are like website.com/index.php/visit/home

and I need to make it search engine friendly and have it .HTML on the end so it’s indexed properly!

Any ideas??

Read full topic

item.title: Generating different HTML for bots
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Well if you implemented it properly they wouldn’t be able to tell presumably, but seriously, don’t bother, your rankings won’t get any better.

Read full topic

item.title: Generating different HTML for bots
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

My code is fine, it can just get a bit bulky for complex stuff - and search engines wouldn’t need any of that info.

I’m not asking if it’s a good idea anyway, I’m asking if search engines like Google will think that they’re indexing a different page and do nasty stuff to my listings.

Read full topic

item.title: Generating different HTML for bots
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

No, just learn how to not write shitty markup.
Always write semantic code, use meta tags, alt attributes on images etc and search engines will figure it out just fine.

Read full topic
